H310.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H347.def: = man; ◄ from the land of {L:Uz<SDBH:עוּץ>}; ► main character of book of Job

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H6605.def: = process by which objects open up ► in order to give access to something located inside or to create a passage

H7043.def: = state in which animals and objects have the ability to move or act with speed ◄ due to lack of weight, agility, strength, training, or energy

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H347.def: = man; ◄ from the land of {L:Uz<SDBH:עוּץ>}; ► main character of book of Job

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H6.def: = state of not being located in the place where it is expected to be

H3915.def: = the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H2029.def: = process by which someone becomes pregnant

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H2822.def: = state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion

H433.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H4605.def: = action by which humans do something to (other) humans or deities that is not in line with the behavior that they committed themselves to

H1875.def: = action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

H5105.def: = light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom

H3313.def: = process by which a light bearing object gives out or reflects a bright light

H2822.def: = state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion

H6757.def: literally: shadow of death, only found in poetry; hence: = state in which there is a total absence of light ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer to distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, fear, death, and oblivion

H6053.def: = a visible collection of condensed water vapor hanging in the atmosphere, often high above the ground; ≈ sometimes associated with darkness and gloom

H3650.def: literally: bitter; hence: = state in which an event is of a very serious nature, and potentially fatal

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H1204.def: = causative process by which a creature or object causes someone else to be in deep distress

H652.def: = state of total absence of light; ≈ associated with suffering and death

H3915.def: = the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

H2302.def: = state in which humans feel happiness

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H4557.def: = an oral or written account of something

H3391.def: = period of time, measured by a complete cycle in the phases of the moon

H3915.def: = the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

H1565.def: = state in which humans are unable to conceive a child

H779.def: = to consign someone or something to death, damage, or destruction, usually by invoking the name of a deity if the agent is human; ◄ this is done as punishment, out of contempt, anger, or hostility, or because one was hired to do so

H6895.def: = causative action by which humans or deities consign humans to death, usually by invoking the name of a deity if the agent is human; ◄ this is done as punishment, out of contempt, fear, anger, or hostility, or because one was paid to do so; ► the effectiveness of a curse partially depends on the authority of the one pronouncing it

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H6264.def: = state in which someone is prepared for an event

H5782.def: = process by which someone wakes up from his sleep

H3882.def: = large mythical monster living in the sea and looking like a giant croccodile or similar reptile

H5399.def: = the time of day before the sun comes up and after the sun goes down

H3556.def: = celestial body, providing light, and assisting the sun and moon in ruling day and night; ◄ created and controled by the divine; ≈ associated with a high and elevated position and sometimes personified as creatures that can sing and wage war

H2821.def: = process by which the light gradually disappears, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars can no longer reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, death, and lack of enlightenment

H6960.def: = state in which humans are confident that their longing will be fulfilled

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H216.def: = light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H6079.def: = the folds of skin ► that cover the eye when closed

H7837.def: = the first appearance of light in the sky in the early morning

H5462.def: = causative action by which humans or deities close the entrance to a space with the help of a {L:door<SDBH:דֶּלֶת>}

H1817.def: = a hinged barrier at the entrance to a town, building, or room; ◄ usually made out of wood, but occasionally also out of metal; ► provides or prevents access; ≈ sometimes associated with vulnerability

H990.def: = front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects

H5641.def: = state in which people or objects are in a location where they cannot be readily seen or where danger cannot reach them

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H4191.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

H7358.def: = part of the lower body of women and mammals where offspring are conceived and in which they grow until their birth; ≈ sometimes extended to refer to a woman, the time of birth, the place where something is produced, and the innermost part of an area

H1478.def: = process by which a human being breathes his last breath, ◄ either as a result of a natural cause or of an unnatural cause, ► resulting in death

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H990.def: = front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects

H4069.def: = a reference to the cause, reason or purpose of an event; normally used in  questions with the purpose of identifying that cause, reason, or purpose; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that these things cannot be identified

H1290.def: = central area of the leg where the thigh is joined to the lower leg; ≈ associated with stability and strength

H6923.def: = action by which humans place themselves in front of individuals or groups, facing either forward or backward, ► and either with good or with evil intentions; ≈ sometimes used figuratively in situations where humans come before God in worship, or where God confronts enemies, or when certain conditions are personified

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H3243.def: = action by which newborn children drink milk from their mother's breasts

H6258.def: = a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

H7901.def: = state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security

H8252.def: = state in which an inanimate object does not move

H3462.def: = state in which humans are asleep; ≈ sometimes associated with security, sometimes with death, sometimes with being inactive

H227.def: = referent pointing to a specific point in time, either in the past or the future

H5117.def: = action by which humans or animals stop their current or regular activities, ► often with the purpose of recovering their strength

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H3289.def: = action by which humans or deities exercise their minds to determine how they are going to achieve a particular purpose

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H1129.def: = causative action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one

H2723.def: = state in which a land, building, or town has been totally destroyed, ► to the extent that nobody can live there anymore

H176.def: = particle linking two entities by which X and Y are alternative options that exclude each other

H8269.def: = someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere

H2091.def: = metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity

H4390.def: = state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H3701.def: = silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

H176.def: = particle linking two entities by which X and Y are alternative options that exclude each other

H2934.def: = action by which humans cause themselves to be invisible so that their location cannot be determined

H5309.def: = a baby who died in the womb

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H216.def: = light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H2308.def: = process by which objects stop existing in this world

H7267.def: = state in which the body of humans and animals shakes involuntarily, ◄ typically as a result of fear, insecurity, excitement, or other emotions

H3019.def: = state in which humans have lost their strength as a result of laborious work which requires a lot of energy

H3581.def: = state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

H5117.def: = action by which humans or animals stop their current or regular activities, ► often with the purpose of recovering their strength

H615.def: = person who is locked up in a prison or other location where one does not have the freedom to act and go at will

H7599.def: = state in which humans live a peaceful life and have nothing to fear

H5065.def: = a person who forces humans and animals to perform certain activities

H5650.def: = man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

H2670.def: = state of not being under the control of someone else

H113.def: = man who is in a position of authority over another person or object as a legal owner, employer, husband, or sovereign; or a person or deity who is referred to as such in a conversation or prayer

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H216.def: = light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

H4751.def: = a small quantity of a liquid

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H2442.def: = action by which humans or deities consciously remain in a particular state

H4194.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H2658.def: = action by which animals strike the ground with their feet

H4301.def: = objects of value that are usually kept invisible from others to keep them safe

H8056.def: = state in which humans feel and show great joy

H1524.def: mainly in poetical texts: = state in which humans feel and show great joy

H7797.def: poetic term; = state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H6913.def: = place where one or more people are buried, such as a hole in a rock or in the ground, or a place which was constructed specifically for this purpose; ≈ associated with death, stench and decay, uncleanness

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H5641.def: = state in which people or objects are in a location where they cannot be readily seen or where danger cannot reach them

H433.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H1157.def: = path through which a certain entity can be accessed, which can vary from a relatively narrow opening on one side to the entire surrounding space

H585.def: = act by which humans make a deep inarticulate sound ◄ caused by pain, grief, or severe suffering

H3899.def: = a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

H7581.def: = action by which animals, humans, or deities produce a full, deep, prolonged sound as made by a lion

H5413.def: = process by which water flows from heaven in the form of rain

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

16.gl: to be poured out > to happen with intensity

H6343.def: = process by which humans tremble or shake, ◄ as a result of a strong emotion of fear and concern for one's safety

H6342.def: = process by which humans tremble or shake, ◄ as a result of strong emotions of joy, awe, or fear

H857.def: = to move to a certain location, seen from that location's perspective

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H3025.def: = state in which humans are in a state of fear in the face of imminent danger

H7951.def: = state in which humans can live without fear or concerns, which is either or not appropriate depending on the situation

H8252.def: = state in which an inanimate object does not move

H5117.def: = action by which humans or animals stop their current or regular activities, ► often with the purpose of recovering their strength

H7267.def: = state in which the body of humans and animals shakes involuntarily, ◄ typically as a result of fear, insecurity, excitement, or other emotions
